com.esri.mo2.map.ext
Class BaseGeoCodeStyle

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.ext.BaseGeoCodeStyle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, GeoCodeStyle
public class BaseGeoCodeStyle
extends Object
implements GeoCodeStyle

A standard implementation of GeoCodeStyle that is defined by java.util.Properties. This class contains properties in the form: 


 	input1.name: 1st input tag name
 	inputN.name: Nth input tag name
 	inputN.desc: Nth input tag description
 	definitionN.name: Nth definition tag name
 	definitionN.desc: Nth definition tag description

getInputTagWidth

public int getInputTagWidth(int index)
Description copied from interface: GeoCodeStyle
Returns the width of an input tag for the specified tag index. This is basically the initial number of characters wide, for a visual control that will be used to enter a value.

Specified by:
getInputTagWidth in interface GeoCodeStyle
Parameters:
index - the tag index
Returns:
the input tag width
Throws:
NumberFormatException - if the number in the properties file is invalid
See Also:
GeoCodeStyle.getInputTagWidth(int)

getInputTagType

public String getInputTagType(int index)
Description copied from interface: GeoCodeStyle
Returns the type of an input tag for the specified tag index. The result will be a string that consists of either the value "TEXT" to indicate that the end-user must type in a text value, or the value "COMBO" followed by a comma-separated list of values. For example "COMBO Sydney,Papeete,Los Angeles".

Specified by:
getInputTagType in interface GeoCodeStyle
Parameters:
index - the tag index
Returns:
the input tag type

Parameters:

Returns:
the index of the input tag, or -1 if tag is not found in this style

getPreferredDefinitionFields

public String[] getPreferredDefinitionFields(int index)
Description copied from interface: GeoCodeStyle
Returns an array of preferred Field names for the indicated definition tag. The calling code can examine the available Fields of a FeatureClass Layer and choose a preferred Field for populating a UserInterface by default.

Specified by:
getPreferredDefinitionFields in interface GeoCodeStyle
Parameters:
index - the tag index
Returns:
the array of names
